tool.name: DANTE_LTR retrotransposon identification
tool.command: python ${__tool_directory__}/detect_putative_ltr_wrapper.py --gff3 '$dante' --reference_sequence '$reference' -M $max_missing --output output --cpu 32 && mv output.gff3 $te_ltr_gff && mv output_statistics.csv $statistics

param.name: dante
param.label: GFF3 output from DANTE pipeline - full output

param.name: max_missing
param.label: Maximum number of missing protein domains to tolerate in full length retrotransposon

data.name: te_ltr_gff
data.label: LTR retrotransposons annotation (GFF3) based on DANTE annotation $dante.hid and reference $reference.hid

data.name: statistics
data.label: LTR retrotransposons detection summary based on $dante.hid and reference $reference.hid

tool.help:
This tool uses output from DANTE annotation pipeline to identify full length LTR transposable elements. Output is in the GFF3 format and include annotation of 5' and 3' Long Terminal Repeats, Target Site Duplication (TSD) and primer binding site (PBS).
All identified elements contains set of protein domains as defined in REXdb_. Based on the results of detection of structural features, elements falls into five categories:
- elements with domains, 5'LTR, 3'LTR, TSD and PBS - rank DLTP - elements with domains, 5'LTR, 3'LTR and PBS (TSD was not found) rank DLP - elements with domains, 5' LTR, 3'LTR, TSD (PBS was not found) - rank DTL - elements with protein domains, 5'LTR and 3'LTR (PBS and LDS were not found) - rank DL - elements as cluster of proteins domains with same classification, no LTRs - rank D
.. _REXdb: https://doi.org/10.1186/s13100-018-0144-1
Principles of detection of LTR retrotransposons is describet in github_ repository of this tool.
.. _github: https://github.com/kavonrtep/dante_ltr
